Flash¶

Flash drum simulation is based on vapor-liquid equilibrium using Dortmund modified UNIFAC activity coefficients and modified Raoult’s law.

In [1]:

from biosteam import Species, Stream
from biosteam.units import Flash
# Set up feed
Stream.species = Species('Glycerol', 'Water')
feed = Stream('feed', flow=(300, 1000))
feed.T = feed.bubble_T()[0] # Feed at bubble point T

# Simulate flash drum
F1 = Flash('F1',
           ins=feed,
           outs=('vapor', 'crude glycerin'),
           P=101325, # Pa
           T=410.15) # K
F1.simulate()

# See streams
F1.diagram()
F1.show(T='degC', P='atm')

Flash: F1
ins...
[0] feed
    phase: 'l', T: 100.7 degC, P: 1 atm
    flow (kmol/hr): Glycerol  300
                    Water     1e+03
outs...
[0] vapor
    phase: 'g', T: 137 degC, P: 1 atm
    flow (kmol/hr): Glycerol  2.32
                    Water     958
[1] crude_glycerin
    phase: 'l', T: 137 degC, P: 1 atm
    flow (kmol/hr): Glycerol  298
                    Water     42.4

In [2]:

# Design results
F1.results()
